description: From Middle English comly, cumly, cumlich, from Old English cymlīċ, cȳmlīċ (compare Old English cȳme (“fine, exquisite”), from Proto-Germanic *kūmiz (“delicate”)), from Proto-Germanic *kūmalīkaz (“pitiful, dear”). Cognate with Middle Dutch komlick, komelick, Middle High German komelīh, gomelīh.

adjectives.description: comely (comparative comelier or more comely, superlative comeliest or most comely)

entries.meaning: (dated, of a person) Pleasing or attractive to the eye.
